Individuals with PWS have distinctive facial features, short stature, and often intellectual disabilities.

The most common form of trisomy is Down syndrome (trisomy 21), but there are other forms, such as trisomy 13 and trisomy 18. In this case, the person has a trisomy of chromosome 15, which is not a common trisomy.
